snippet: The state water board postponed an emergency meeting today on whether to impose strict rationing rules, apparently so major decisions about the drought could be left to a task force appointed by Gov. Pete Wilson.   Mr. Wilson's press secretary, Bi...
lead_paragraph: The state water board postponed an emergency meeting today on whether to impose strict rationing rules, apparently so major decisions about the drought could be left to a task force appointed by Gov. Pete Wilson. Mr. Wilson's press secretary, Bill Livingstone, said the board had been asked to wait until after Feb. 15, when the Governor's team is to recommend a plan to deal with the worst possible situation that might be expected in 1991, the fifth year of drought.

headline.main: California Delays Strict Rules On Saving Water in Drought
